alert.note: Alert for Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 30 at 12:01PM EDT until May 01 at 11:08PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Hampshire...Maine... Pemigewasset River At Woodstock affecting Grafton County. Pemigewasset River At Plymouth affecting Belknap and Grafton Counties. Saco River At Conway affecting Cumberland, Oxford and Carroll Counties. Presumpscot River At West Falmouth affecting Cumberland County. Swift River At Roxbury affecting Oxford County. Suncook River At North Chichester affecting Merrimack and Belknap Counties. For the Pemigewasset River...including Woodstock, Plymouth...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Saco River...including Conway, West Buxton...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Presumpscot River...including West Falmouth...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Swift River...including Roxbury...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Suncook River...including North Chichester...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pemigewasset River at Woodstock. * WHEN...From late tonight to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins. At 11.0 feet, Route 175 floods to a depth of 1 foot at Cox Farm Road in Woodstock. Campgrounds along the river also flood. At 13.0 feet, Route 175 floods to a depth of 2 to 4 feet from Cox Farm Road to Meadow Lane in Woodstock. Low lying areas along US route 3 also flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 4.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 4.1 feet this afternoon. It will then rise above flood stage late tonight to 10.9 feet tomorrow morning. It will fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon to 4.9 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then rise to 6.8 feet early Wednesday morning. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
